poem:
"Revelation In The Cinema"

In unfolding reels spun by artful hands,  
Eternal Suncoast empowers, bland though it be.  
In the past's disguise, future converses,  
Unoriginal, yet sweet as honest verses.  

Unvarnished charm it shovels, a clever guise;  
A filmed paradox, truth and lies intertwine.  
Low stakes, yet soap opera climbs to the skies,  
In fiction's glow, reality does truly shine.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Suncoast review – Laura Linney helps lift adequate family saga Premiering at Sundance 2024 yet assembled as if it were primed for the festival two or three decades earlier, Suncoast is the kind of broad, sunny Searchlight crowd-pleaser that aims to make up for its lack of originality with an abundance of heavily shoveled charm. It’s a strategy that just about works when the stakes are low and soapy but films in this subgenre ultimately". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Suncoast review – Laura Linney helps lift adequate family saga Premiering at Sundance 2024 yet assembled as if it were primed for the festival two or three decades earlier, Suncoast is the kind of broad, sunny Searchlight crowd-pleaser that aims to make up for its lack of originality with an abundance of heavily shoveled charm. It’s a strategy that just about works when the stakes are low and soapy but films in this subgenre ultimately
